claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination broadens the MHC-I antigen repertoire.

evidence.quote: Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6%
Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase.

claims.caveat: Mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: The combination of intratumoral mRNA vaccine and anti-PD-L1 improves tumor control.

evidence.quote: Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice
Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: Type I interferon signaling is essential for the sensitization effect.

evidence.quote: Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

claims.caveat: Validation relies heavily on antibody-based blockade in mouse models.

claims.claim: Prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination is associated with better ICI outcomes in humans.

evidence.quote: Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.
